snippet: Hal Steinbrenner, the managing general partner of the Yankees, said he wanted to trim down to the luxury tax threshold of $189 million by 2014 to avoid paying future penalties.
abstract: New York Yankees managing general partner Hal Steinbrenner says he wants to trim down to the luxury tax threshold of $189 million by 2014 to avoid paying future penalties; acknowledges that, unlike his late father George Steinbrenner, he is more committed to staying competitive in the framework of a less elastic budget.
lead_paragraph: Hal Steinbrenner, the managing general partner of the Yankees, said he wanted to trim down to the luxury tax threshold of $189 million by 2014 to avoid paying future penalties.

headline.seo: Yankees Want to Cut Payroll to $189 Million by 2014
headline.main: New Plan: Yankees Look to Cut Payroll
